posts.post_content:
Hi All.

I am still looking for a T206 Zachariah Wheat with an American Beauty back!

I have a few interesting cards here (back stamp/ historical writing ... diamond cut ... slight wet sheet transfer), and perhaps we can strike a deal, should you have a Wheat to spare:

1.) Jon McGraw (portrait-NO cap) ... Brown Hindu ... SGC 10 1 ... this is kind of a unique card. On the back, there is stamping and writing: stamped: "Fredrick Benedict Gessner" ... writing: initials "f.b.g.", and in a nice calligraphy style writing "Princeton".

2.) Sam Crawford (with bat) ... American Beauty 350 (NO decorative frame)... SGC 40 3 this one has a unique cut to it, as you can see.

3.) Hooks Wiltse (portrait-w/ cap) ... Piedmont 460 f. 25 ... SGC 40 3 ... this one has a slight wet sheet transfer on the bottom left/ front. Kind of quirky I suppose.



Shoot me a PM. Thanks!

Derek
Out of curiosity, can anyone see this thread? It still says "1 view".

Hey Derek!  I saw it yesterday evening, and it is still here now.

Best,

Andy
Thank You! I was just confused because it still said "1 view". Thanks, this felt like the Twilight Zone.
The view counter got messed up when the site went down. Leon says it is in the process of being fixed....Oh, by the way you have your Wiltse listed as no cap.....

[quote name="Bocabirdman" post=1094672]The view counter got messed up when the site went down. Leon says it is in the process of being fixed....Oh, by the way you have your Wiltse listed as no cap.....[/QUOTE]

OOPS! Thank you. The Bird is the Word!
